comment: Bullard is a cool guy and will MAKE SURE that everybody participates. Are you the kind to sit in the back and answer 2 or 3 question over the entire semester? He WILL call you out. He can be annoying or pushy sometimes to keep convos going but at the end if the day this will be one of the easiest classes you will take at KSU.

He was not responsive at all. I sent an email at the beginning of the semester, he never responded. Everyone else in the class had the same thing to say. 15 weeks into the course and he had only graded up to about week 4. If you are the type of student that needs a responsive professor who gives feedback, stay away. If you want an easy A, take him.

Easily my favorite professor. Speak your mind, disagree, joke around and have a good time while learning to communicate better. Make sure you let him go off on tangents and go back and forth with him.

This teachers was a joy to learn from. You have weekly readings you talk about in class but they aren't really mandatory. Attendance is marked and there were graded discussion post for every week. He is hilarious though.

Gotta be top 10 Professors at KSU. He is amazing and his class teaches so many life skills and he can relate to almost anything and he is funny. His class has a weekly discussion post and a 5 question quiz that is based off a chapter reading that's discussed in class. Along with 1 final group project. Take Prof. Bullard, you can't regret it!
Best Prof ever, as long as you do your work you will get an A.

This class is very easy especially if you are savvy on sociological topics alr. The prof is not interactive and he will not respond to emails. Quizzes r 5 questions v easy. Disc post every week no word count. Textbook is required but 98% sure he would post the assigned reading each week. Final exam is group project, annoying but doable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: This was an easy online class, all materials were provided and assignments were easy. Quizzes and discussions that are due every week, tests, 1 paper, and final exam. Doesn't respond to emails and is not very interactive with students. Everything in the class is highly accessible, and overall a good class.

This class is very easy and a great elective. There is a somewhat complex group project at the end which is difficult because this is an online course. There is a quiz and a discussion each week but no lockdown. You can get through the quiz without doing the reading.

The class was pretty easy! If you are looking for an easy elective take it! There are discussions but the topics are very interesting. There are quizzes but they are not on the lockdown browser. There is a group project at the end with the group being assigned by the professor. Overall, easy and interesting class!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Not a great professor. If you want an easy A take this class. He doesn't put in grades timely, but grades are super easy because of this. He rarely responds to emails. I took this class online and there was a quiz and a discussion due every week and a large group paper at the end. Overall very easy class.
Worst prof ever. Doesn't provide grades in timely manner, readings and tests often unrelated, doesn't respond to to questions.
Professor Bullard was great, I really enjoyed his class. A lot of reading and writing but you will learn a lot as well. He was quick to respond about assignments and genuinely cares for his students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: TAKE HIS CLASS! I was expecting to have a boring Gen Ed but instead had a deeply insightful discussion about leadership and intercultural competence every week. Beautiful Bullard was amazing, he was funny and respectful so long as you applied yourself and did the frankly easy work. Textbook technically required but was barely used.

Professor Bullard's Leadership 3201 class was an amazing experience and let me tell you, I am very thankful I took it.  For this class, you can expect to be challenged personally, morally, and ethically.  The development I have seen in myself from this course cannot be understated. I recommend Professor Bullard for everyone.

This class was LDRS 3201, Leadership & Multiculturalism. This was a really cool class as it covered many relevant topics in current events today. There are detailed discussion posts every week. Just make sure you stay on top of these since they count significantly towards your overall grade. The final is a major project but very doable. No regrets.

Freshmen seminar has a bad stigma, but this professor makes this class TRULY what it needs to be. Prof Bullard makes you work for the class, but doesn't go excessive on assignments and due dates. Very flexible and very realistic about due dates. He is NOT going to let you slide through, you will be active somehow. Teaches life lessons.

Professor Bullard is an awesome Instructor. He cares about his students. I took LDRS 3000 online and have no regrets. Weekly quizzes and discussion posts. So long as you stay on top of the material, you should earn an A. There is a Leadership Interview paper towards the end of the semester but its not hard. Take Mr. Bullard, you will thank me later

Professor Bullard posts weekly modules with all of the content you need to succeed on both the weekly quizzes and discussion posts. He is not a tough grader, if you do the work you will earn your grade. He posts lots of announcements to help keep everybody on track and is very detailed in them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy A. Don't need book ne posts powerpoints on each chapter. The discussions are worth the most because there are five to six that are due in one day but they are easy. Quizlet helped a little with tests and powerpoints help a little with tests.

He is inspiring and very generous. The only thing you're going have to get use to is maybe the sports analysis and shim sometimes going off in a tangent. But overall he is a great person, who will quizz you on a lot of what's on the syllabus. Be prepared to go places, talk to people, and just overall have fun.

Best professor I've had. He really cares and wants you to understand the material. In-class discussions are based off what you read in the textbook for homework, but it's honestly common sense. I took a hybrid and the only hybrid part was a 10 question quiz every week. Easy A. He knew everyone in class by name, and what HS you went to. AMAZING!

Professor Bullard was by far one of my favorite professors that I have taken. If I could take him again, I would. He makes going to class not so dreadful. His lectures are entertaining and he is a very funny, sports loving guy. He cares about his students he's honestly probably the only professor i've had that knew everyones name in our class.

He's a great guy! He cares about his students and knows this is an easy A. Has you read the book but its basic knowledge. Was able to exempt the final because I had an A in the class. Group Project & a few in class assignments. Not hard at all!

Pretty great guy! He's authentic and wants to get to know you. Most of the classes he just stands there and talks about what our reading was, but it's not boring. The material is common sense stuff, which is stupid you have to buy a book and pay for the class. You don't have to take the final is you had an A. It was an easy A for me. Take him.

Bullard was a great professor, but almost all of his lectures had nothing to do with the readings from the book. But his lectures were question biased and really made everyone inside the class think about the touchy subjects he brought up. He truly cares about every single one of his students, he wants each and everyone of them to pass.

Bullard was an amazing professor, his lectures could be a bit random and lengthy but most days we got out of class early so that made up for it. Definitely spoke a lot on some touchy issues which kept things interesting for me but beware if you are heavily opinionated. Needed an A in the class to exempt final but had an 87, he bumped me up anyways.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A great seminar professor, loves his students and loves to talk so be ready to read and talk about what you read.
Bullard is my main man. He is sooooo funny and compassionate. Class was DUMB easy if you do your work and show up. Stay on top of deadlines. He will not let you fail.

I took this class my first semester as a freshman. I made all As in every class except this one. I wouldnt recommend this professor. His instructions for certain assignments werent clear and he lost some of my assignments & gave me a 0. Also, turned in another assignment that he gave me half credit for.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: honestly dont know how this man is a college proffessor but ight
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Online quizzes every week that you can use the textbook on. He is very funny and loves sports, so he is very easy to talk to. Lectures are about a chapter in the textbook that you need to read, but not bad at all. Gives extra credit two or three times though out the semester, which adds points to your final grade. Very easy class. Very easy A.
An amazing professor, the best one to get for freshman seminar. really cares about your grade and has amazing lectures. definiely read. You wont regret taking him
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Bullard is a great guy and professor! He takes the time to learn his students and bonds daily. Book is required, but code is pretty much optional. The ebook comes with a updated chapter that he tells you to read and one assignment online (which you can use another online source to substitute it if you ask). Barely studies for quizzes got a A+

TAKE HIM!! He is the best I promise. Everyone else was complaining about their KSU Seminar class while I was having an amazing time with minimal work. However, you must read to pass the class and show up but he makes it interesting and fun and does not overwork you. Very inspirational and loves talking about football. You'll love him too.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Would take again

comment: Professor Bullard is the teacher you need to have for your seminar. Not only does he teach and help you apply it but he is incredibly inspirational. He will help you personally grow. He does go off on tangent mostly about sports. There is a group project and readings and participation is highly encouraged. Any quiz or test is usually open notes.
Great guy, keeps classes interesting. Attendance is a part of your grade so can't skip. Easy A if you just do the little work you're given.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Would take again

comment: Mr. Bullard is the most amazing professor I've ever had. His lectures are incredible and very inspirational. He has true passion for everything he talks about, and he does love to talk. Just listen, read, talk, and you'll pass. His lectures are a lot more fun when you participate. Wish I could have him for every class.

If you like sports, take Professor Bullard. He can talk about sports and go off on tangents for days. But, his class was very easy if you take the time to do the work. There is a group presentation, but it isn't graded very strictly. He's very inspirational and will prepare you for the rest of college.
Professor Bullard truly cares about his students and always has them laughing. Although a lot of reading is required, I strongly recommend you take Bullard! I absolutely loved him.

Loved, loved, loved Professor Bullard. He is a very caring man who makes sure that he gets to know each student and that they know what we were learning and were prepared for life. I would take him again if he taught a different course besides a freshman class.
This is best professor at ksu hands down . I actually learned life skills from this class . TAKE THIS CLASS TAKE IT TAKE IT TAKE IT

He is a great professor and I wish he would teach other classes. He has a lot of reading discussions in class, but he manages to relate them to real world events and makes them fun overall. A good amount of homework and quizzes, but if you read you will pass.

Best teacher I've had so far. He doesn't talk about the boring stuff in the book. He makes class a huge discussion and tries to talk about things that everyone can comment on or chime in. Easy A. Online tests so use book, and if you have an A in class exempt the final.

I promise you, you will not get a better teacher. Just show up and do your work, and you'll get an A. He's a cool guy and you won't really think of him as a teacher, we had a lot of interesting discussions in class that I would have actually gone to if attendance wasn't mandatory. Also, if you have an A in the class, you are exempt from the final.

Professor Bullard is the teacher you actually WANT to hang out with outside of class. This man is honestly the most genuine and down to earth teacher I have ever had. Everything is online and SUPER easy. He understands this class is mandatory and tries to make it fun. His lectures are always interesting and his humor makes them better.

Favorite professor in college so far, very easy and is very laid back. He is cool with everyone and understands students. I highly recommend taking him because he doesn't overload you with work and I actually enjoyed going to class.

He is my favorite professor this semester, I was going through a really hard time in the beginning of the semester and somehow he could tell and talked to me after class and basically said I could come to him for anything. Great man, awesome teacher, loves his job and students. I wish I could have more professors like him!
He is an amazing teacher. Period.
The lectures in class were amazing! The only class my first semester where we actually got to voice our opinions on real world issues. He was also really funny and easy to get along with.
If I could take him again I would. He's a really laid back professor, and as long as you go to each class its an easy A. Exams and quizzes are very easy. Stress-free class.

He is lit! Best professor I ever had! Literally full of energy, loves his job, can tell he cares about students. He's like your school dad because he always speaks with a purpose(talks about real life stuff ties current events into lessons) Great teacher, great person! Loves sports, basketball coach for a private school.

If you have to take a first-year seminar class, you should take him! Best FYS professor. He is fun and it is easy to pass. Make sure you show up to class, though. Attendance is key. Quizzes and test are online. You need the book for homework and reading.

He genuinely cares about his students and likes to help them on a one on one basis. If something goes wrong, he'll trust that you won't mess up again and give you a second chance, as long as you participate in his class. He really likes to talk, so humor him and you'll actually have a lot more fun than if you just sit there! Love him!

Enjoyable professor. I was in a Learning Community. He likes to go off topic and talk about sports, but it makes class more fun. His lectures tend to go over current events, which is great. Assignments are simple and straightforward. Tests are online. The exam is exempted with an A and is online as well. Take him!

TAKE HIM! Show up to class because after your fourth absence your grade goes down. REALLY EASY. He wants you to have a great first semester and strives to give you your first A in college. If you have an A in the class before the final, you don't have to take it. Quizzes and tests are online! BEST professor ever!!!

Amazing teacher. He actually cares about his students and KSU as a whole. He lays out all of the assignments at the beginning so you can submit them at any time. He makes the class time interesting and funny the WHOLE time. Take his class!!

Best professor I've had so far. Genuinely cares for his students and wants to see all of his students leave with an A. He's funny and class is fun. Makes the class something you can actually relate to; doesn't just go by some standard learning objective junk. TAKE HIM!
Class was always fun with him. As long as you participate in class you will be on his good side and will definitely have an A in the class. One of the easiest professors  you will ever have. TAKE HIM

Mr. Bullard is hilarious, and makes KSU Seminar ABOUT KSU, which is what this class is really meant for. He gives all of his assignments at the beginning of the semester, so everything you need to do is very clear cut. If you miss more than 5 classes, he takes 5%-10% off of your grade, and don't use your cellphone! TAKE HIM HE'S GREAT

He really cares about his students and he WANTS to be the one to give freshman their first A. He says participation matters, but he isn't going to kill your grade if your not a talker. Attendance matters to a certain degree (can't miss more than 4 days i think but besides that you're good). He tries to help students have stress free first semester

So glad I chose him as my professor. He will be there for you always, honestly cares for his students. If he feels the need to stop or cancel a lecture to talk about something thats bothering us then he will. Looked forward to his class all the time. Extremely respected by students, would take any class he taught.

There's no other option for a professor if Professor Bullard is an option. He's so helpful, so kind, so funny, and extremely considerate. He's an EASY A and really wants to see his student's succeed and understand the material. He begins each class with discussing eachother's week and communicating with one another. Favorite Professor!

He's a great professor if you don't mind teaching all the information to yourself and he gets off topic very easily so never any real lecture time. Attendance and participation are important and if you get an A in the class before finals, you can exempt it. Super easy assignments and grades pretty leniently. Gives answers to quizzes in class.
All the assignments are put up ahead of time. He is super funny and a cool professor! Wants to make an A, he goes over all the answers to the quizzes.
Best teacher I have ever had. All assignments are put up at the beginning of the semester so you can complete them on time or ahead of time. Great speaker and enjoys talking to everyone.

I loved Professor Bullard. He made seminar fun. Gives all assignments at the beginning of the semester so you can get them all done and have no work for the rest of the year. Can't miss more than 3 classes or -10 off final grade. Just go to class, PARTICIPATE - he is more likely to give you quiz answers and stuff if you just participate!

Easy A,All assignments are listed at the beginning of the year so you can do them and be done for the rest of the semester (easy work) Tells you to read but you do not have to he goes off and talks about his life examples more than book. E-book is online to read. Couple of quizzes online he goes over some and you can use book no final if you have A

I love taking Professor Bullard class!! He made my first college class very fun, easy and simple. I felt like his class took away from all the stress in my other classes. A very funny and caring man. I would love to take his class again.

This professor was probably one of the best professors I had this semester at KSU. If you are looking to take KSU 1101, take Professor. Bullard. He will not disappoint, and it is a fun class to be in!
Definitely had fun taking this class, I would do it again.
Instructor made it fun to be in class.

If I could take him again, I most definitely would! By far the best professor I have had this semester. It's easy to get an A: show up, do your homework, read some and you'll be fine. Hilarious professor and genuinely cares about his students. I lucked up because I chose blindly for seminar. Take him, you  will not regret it!
Easily the coolest professor at KSU.. I wouldn't take any other professor. Awesome teacher and he's really funny! If he taught any other class I would take him again.
